SEARCH
Package it.disi.unitn

Class VideoCreator

java.lang.Object
it.disi.unitn.VideoCreator
public class VideoCreator extends Object
This class is used to create videos using different options compatible with ffmpeg.

  • Constructor Summary

    • VideoCreator

      public VideoCreator(@NotNull @NotNull FFMpegBuilder builder, @NotNull @NotNull String outputFile, @NotNull @NotNull String @NotNull ... inputImages) throws NotEnoughArgumentsException
      The constructor of this class.
      Parameters:
      builder - The FFMpegBuilder instance that called this constructor
      outputFile - The path to the output file
      inputImages - A list of paths to the input files
      Throws:
      NotEnoughArgumentsException - if any of the arguments given to this constructor is null

  • Method Details

    • setFrameRate

      public void setFrameRate(int val) throws InvalidArgumentException
      This method sets the output video's frame rate.
      Parameters:
      val - The output video's frame rate
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - when the given frame rate is less than or equal to 0.

    • setVideoDuration

      public void setVideoDuration(int val) throws InvalidArgumentException
      This method sets the duration of the output video.
      Parameters:
      val - The duration of the output video
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - when the given duration is less than or equal to 0.

    • setStartInstant

      public void setStartInstant(int val) throws InvalidArgumentException
      This method sets the starting instant of the resulting video, but it requires that the input file be itself a video of any format supported by ffmpeg.
      Parameters:
      val - The starting instant of the new video
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - when the starting instant of the new video is less than or equal to 0.

    • setCodecID

      public void setCodecID(@NotNull @NotNull String codecID) throws NotEnoughArgumentsException, InvalidArgumentException
      This method sets the codec ID of the output video.
      Parameters:
      codecID - The given codec ID
      Throws:
      NotEnoughArgumentsException - if the given codec ID is null
      InvalidArgumentException - if the given codec ID is not supported by ffmpeg

    • setVideoSizeID

      public void setVideoSizeID(@NotNull @NotNull String videoSizeID) throws InvalidArgumentException
      This method sets the width and height of the resulting video by means of the given video size ID.
      Parameters:
      videoSizeID - The given video size ID
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - if the given video size ID is not supported by ffmpeg

    • setVideoQuality

      public void setVideoQuality(int quality)
      This method sets the quality of the output video.
      Parameters:
      quality - The quality of the output video

    • setVideoSize

      public void setVideoSize(int width, int height) throws InvalidArgumentException
      This method sets the size of the resulting video by means of the given width and height.
      Parameters:
      width - The given width
      height - The given height
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - if the given width or height parameter is less than or equal to 0

    • setVideoBitRate

      public void setVideoBitRate(int val, @NotNull @NotNull String mode) throws InvalidArgumentException
      This method sets the output video's bitrate in Kilobits or Megabits.
      Parameters:
      val - The bitrate value
      mode - A value between "k" and "m" (short for Kilobit and Megabit respectively)
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - if the "mode" argument is null or it is not equal to "k" or "m"

    • createCommand

      public void createCommand() throws InvalidArgumentException
      This method creates the command than, when run, will create the output video.
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - if the video width or height or the video size ID field is null
